nodes.text: Osma bags were small leather pouches filled with a collection of trinkets and a small pinch of Socorran sand. Ibhaan'I shamans put osma bags together as a form of blessing. After talking to the recipient, the shaman would select items already in their possession or undertake a journey of several days to gather them. The chosen items would have a meaning to the receiver and reveal the life-destiny path of the recipient.
